subject: Photography
title: Direct vs. Diffused Light
description: A quick, practical guide to Direct vs. Diffused Light.

hook.text: Sunlight on a clear day is harsh and contrasty. On a cloudy day, it's soft and even. Same sun, different light.

buildup.text: Direct light comes from a small, intense source. It creates sharp shadows and high contrast.

discovery.text: Diffused light is scattered through clouds, curtains, or reflectors. Shadows soften and tones become gentle.

twist.text: Overcast days are a portrait photographer's dream. The sky becomes a giant softbox ‚Äî free and everywhere.

climax.text: Neither direct nor diffused light is better. Each serves different moods, stories, and subjects.

punchline.text: Clouds aren't bad weather. They're free diffusion.

quiz.question: What effect does overcast sky have on light?
options: It diffuses sunlight, creating soft, even illumination
